allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Enable automated vision-guided Google Calendar setup

Fixed the agent to use vision-guided automation for Google Calendar
API setup when AGENT_AUTO_APPROVE=1 is enabled, instead of forcing
manual setup steps.

Changes:
- OpenRouter client: Updated model hierarchy and fallback logic
  - Primary: iquest/coder-v1
  - Fallback: Moonshot Kimi variants
  - Improved error handling and logging

- Learning agent: Conditional automation based on AGENT_AUTO_APPROVE
  - When enabled: Uses plan_type="EXECUTE" with action="vision_guided"
  - When disabled: Uses plan_type="SETUP_GUIDE" with action="manual"
  - Updated both LLM prompt and fallback plan generation
  - Agent will now autonomously handle Google Cloud Console setup,
    API enablement, OAuth credential creation, and credential download

With AGENT_AUTO_APPROVE=1, the agent will:
1. Open Google Cloud Console in Chrome
2. Create/select project
3. Enable Google Calendar API
4. Configure OAuth consent screen
5. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials
6. Download credentials.json
7. Complete OAuth flow
8. Access calendar

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add goto action support to hybrid executor

The hybrid executor was missing the ''goto'' action that exists in the
vision executor, causing "Unknown action: goto" errors when the agent
tried to open URLs.

Added:
- goto action handling in execute_action() method
- _execute_goto() method to open URLs in Chrome or default browser
- Automatic protocol detection (adds https:// if missing)

This fixes the agent''s ability to autonomously open Google Cloud
Console and other web-based setup tasks.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Fix OpenRouter model configuration - use valid free models

The agent was configured to use iquest/coder-v1 which is not available
on OpenRouter (only on HuggingFace), causing 400 Bad Request errors.

Updated to use valid OpenRouter free models:
- Primary: qwen/qwen3-coder:free (for planning, chat, summarize)
- Reasoning: deepseek/deepseek-r1-0528:free (for JSON/reasoning tasks)
- Fallback: moonshot models (unchanged)

Changes:
- .env: Updated OPENROUTER_MODEL to qwen/qwen3-coder:free
- openrouter_client.py: Updated all model references
  - DEFAULT_MODELS dictionary
  - Default model in from_env()
  - Hardcoded models in complete_json() and reason_json()

This fixes the "400 Client Error: Bad Request" errors that were
preventing the agent from using OpenRouter fallback when Codex failed.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
